channel.title: How do I put pictures on a post?
channel.description: I know how to take the picture's and everything else, I just dont know how to put them in a post. Sorry if this is the wrong topic =/

item.title: How do I put pictures on a post?
item.dc:creator: @ibronze ibronze
item.description:
@ibronze wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:7, topic:340101”]environmental variables are quite easy, I’ll explain it in moparscape language

Start > Right click Computer > Properties > Underneath tasks > Advanced system settings > Bottom Right > Click Environmental Variables > Click New for user variables > Make variable name: Path > For value put: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin; or the location you put java in. remember the \jdk1.6.0_20 at the end REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERSION YOU HAVE!
I hava done all that, i even have that exact same version! but when i try to go on a client it does the exact same thing, man i hope this get’s fixed.
Now make another variable called Classpath, put the name C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin; or the location you put java in. REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERISON OF JAVA YOU HAVE!

You have made Environmental Variables. Hope this helped :)[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: How do I put pictures on a post?

item.title: How do I put pictures on a post?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

That’s not MoparScape Language. You Need big letters and step by step instructions.

You right click “My Computer”

You click “Properties”

You click “Advanced/Advanced System Settings”

You click “Environmental Variables”

You click “New”

You type “CLASSPATH”

You hit “Tab”

You type: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Note: The Above Path Setting Is Not Correct. You Have To Edit It.

You click “Ok”

You click “New”

You type “PATH”

You hit “Tab”

You type: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin;
Note: The Above Path Setting Is Not Correct. You Have To Edit It.

PLEASE Tell me you understand that…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I put pictures on a post?

item.title: How do I put pictures on a post?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

environmental variables are quite easy.

Go to [size=14pt]Start[/size]

Right click [size=14pt]Computer[/size], Then click properties [size=14pt]Properties [/size]

Underneath tasks you will find [size=14pt]Advanced/Advanced system settings [/size] click on that

Click [size=14pt]Environmental Variables[/size]

Click New for underneath the [size=14pt]user variables[/size]

Make variable name [size=18pt]Path[/size]. For value put: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin; REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERSION YOU HAVE!

Now make another variable called [size=18pt]Classpath[/size], put the name CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERISON OF JAVA YOU HAVE!

You have made Environmental Variables. Hope this helped

Read full topic
